Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a major attack on free speech in Australia.
The proposed powers for ACMA are viewed as undemocratic since ACMA is not an elected body.
There is concern that the legislation will stifle public debate and impose severe penalties on government critics.
The government is exempt from the laws, which is perceived as unfair and biased.
The legislation is compared to censorship practices in authoritarian regimes.
Notable Quotes: This is the greatest political attack on free speech by any Australian government in peace time, since Federation.
The proposed censoring crackdown on 'misinformation and disinformation' is clearly an attempt to make public debate illegal.
This ill-conceived, half baked, Orwellian attempt at free speech destruction needs to be rejected NOW.
